docs.title: Lyth
docs.text: Lyth is a package manager for linux.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Lyth uses several environment variables to configure its behavior.

docs.title: LYTH_CFG_PATH
docs.text:
• Description: Specifies the path to Lyth's configuration directory.
  • Default: ~/.config/lyth.d/

docs.title: LYTH_SILENT
docs.text:
• Description: If set to true, Lyth will suppress most of its output, making it suitable for scripting.
  • Default: Not set.

docs.title: Internal Variables
docs.text: These variables are set by Lyth internally during the execution of package hooks and are available within the hook scripts.

docs.title: LYTH_PKG_DIR_PATH
docs.text: • Description: The absolute path to the directory of the package currently being processed.

docs.title: LYTH_SRC
docs.text: • Description: The absolute path to the src directory of Lyth itself.

docs.title: LYTH_PKG_VERSION
docs.text: • Description: The version of the package currently being processed.

docs.title: Utility Functions (for scripts developers)
docs.text: Lyth provides a set of utility functions that are used internally and can also be used in package hooks.

docs.title: globalThis.:
docs.text:
• _import(path): Imports a module from the package's directory. (LYTH_PKG_DIR_PATH + path)
  • __import(path): Imports the default export of a module from the package's directory. (LYTH_PKG_DIR_PATH + path).default
  • _importSRC(path): Imports a module from Lyth's src directory. (LYTH_SRC + path)
  • createDesktopFile(entry): Creates a .desktop file for launching applications.
